subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] nuff said?
author: Andrea Carr
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_00F7_01CAE326.83380730
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Frank,

Long before I began recording they where talking to me out loud too=
 & you know i wondered about when it happened....they still come talk to me=
 without recording & if there is someone else with me they hear it too...no=
w I say this it is what it is!

Andrea
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  Fr=
om: Frank Sumption 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, April 23=
, 2010 8:29 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] nuff said?


    

   I know what i=
t is, even though I can't even spell it or pronounce it. It's what the skep=
tics and debunkers tout as the answer to all paranormal experience. I think=
 we ought to pull our claws back in, especially me!

   I have gotten "voic=
es" that I thought were perfectly clear, and no one else could hear it, and=
 some I found was just a snippet of music, so yeah, that happens, but it do=
es not eliminate or explain everything from the boxes, and other EVP method=
s, you  just have to be aware of the possibility. Anotherr problem is broad=
cast fragments, sometimes they are just what they sound like, an ad for one=
 thing or another, sometimes they can have sychronistic meaning, and someti=
mes they can be altered in some way to form a messages, such as the recent =
one I had about learning sex, which was seemingly ignored by all cuz it has=
 the "s" word--I guess. The fragments can also be distorted as the radio tu=
ning is swept across a station, I don't accept every word and syllable as m=
eaning something. You have tio judge mnessage by content and personal meani=
ng. 

   I have seen faces stand up in a carpet right in front of me, not s=
omething I just happened across, something that happened live as I watched.=
 For someone to suggest that's imagination I find very offensive.  

   Whe=
n I first switched to a linear sweep in the boxes, I could hear nothing but=
 gibberish, then suddenly I could hear "them" speaking. I doubt that is all=
 imagination either, I think the mind(which is not brain) has to reprogram =
the ears, which are brain, to hear.  I also think the skeptics can not allo=
w this programming to take place, hence they can't hear. I would be very su=
rprised if any of the hard core skeptics even turned on a box for fear that=
 they may hear something that's not there. Rorke(the Phd) implied as much w=
hen he wanted a box to test, or more like debunk. That crap is frikkin' pat=
hetic!




  F-S



   
  On Fri, Apr 23, 2010 at 4:30 PM, April Abercrombi=
e <april@...> wrote:

      
    Pareidolia is not=
 psuedo science. It is an actual, proven, natural functioning of the brain.=


    http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pareidolia

    Please read this article=
, and more, if you have any questions about it being psuedo science. I chos=
e the Wikipedia version because I thought it would be the least offensive t=
o you. Other articles specifically called out EVP and other things.

    Fo=
r the record, I don't think all EVP's are due to pareidolia. 





    On F=
ri, Apr 23, 2010 at 3:47 PM, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wro=
te:

        

       It was implied that all this stuff is "Pareidolia", a=
nd because you could put a name on it that somehow meant it was all explani=
ned. I've been hearing this pseudo scientific BS for 10 years, so I'm a bit=
 touchy. Science explains the paranormal away, and yet people continune to =
photograph images, and get their names, and the names of deseased loved one=
s through EVP, as well as questions answered, and science(althogh not all s=
cientists) just ignores these inconvinient facts and focuses on that we mig=
ht see things that are not there, which I disagree with as well. 

       D=
id you even bother looking at the image on the group home page. That was fr=
om sweeping a TV tuner with a random voltage and video recording the monito=
r screen. So explain away why there is a wolf image embedded in the guy's h=
at, an image of an alien below his ear, and why in God's name does he resem=
bles the classic description of an MIB or Shadow Person?  Pareidolia no dou=
bt!

       F-S


      On Fri, Apr 23, 2010 at 3:19 PM, Rj <rasterer@yahoo=
.com> wrote:

          

              I'm not sure who you're talking to =
about "holier than thou".  But, you are the one who keeps dismissing any qu=
estion about results and testing with phrases like "Bite Me". I don't see a=
nyone else doing that, and I certainly never have.

              I agree t=
rying new things is good.  And discussing results.  And looking for new dir=
ections.   So I'm still not sure who you are upset with.  Perhaps you could=
 be more specific: quote what you have found objectionable, and let us know=
 why?



              --- On Fri, 4/23/10, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl=
@...> wrote:


                From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@=
gmail.com>
                Subject: [EVP-ITC] nuff said?
                To=
: evp-itc@yahoogroups.com
                Date: Friday, April 23, 2010, 12:=
59 PM 



                  

                "Congratulations! bulletbabea=
 has changed your membership status for the
                group EVP-ITC f=
rom Member to Moderator." 

                 Go ahead skepdorks, make my da=
y!  I don't mind some honest debate, but not this holier than thou science =
BS, where you think cuz you stick a label on something it can be dismissed =
as thoroughly debunked. Maybe--I'm easily offended, and I'll take that into=
 account. 

                 F-S
